name: Hotel La Tour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel was pretty much brand new when i visited,so everything was brand new and up to date. The room was a little on the small side but pleasant and comfortable. The bathroom was excellent with a big walk in shower. Location is excellent. 5 mins walk from bullring shopping centre and new street railway station. Great hotel. I recommend! (i did not have breakfast as the hotel was so close to the centre i had breakfast out,rather than pay the inflated price that hotels seem to charge for sausage eggs and beans! £15 per person)
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at an unexpectedly beautiful hotel for a dear friends special bithday with a lovely reception area which gave a real sense of space in modern surroundings. There is an option of self service check in /out or the traditional manned check in. Trey on reception who welcomed us was brilliant and a credit to the hotel and also was the theme running through the hotel the staff were brilliant and so friendly without being over the top. Our room was spotlessly clean modern and really nice with lots of hi tech features with White Company products in the bathroom and for the first time for me a really comfortable bed and pillows.We had some fantastic bar snacks which swayed us into eating at the restaurant that night and what a treat that was .from the excellent service to the wine menu on i pads and of course really really good tasty food the night was faultless . Breakfast followed in a similar theme with a fantastic array of food in a buffet style accompanied by that now trademark brilliant service. This hotel is really a great find with tremendous staff comfortable spotless rooms and great food whats not to like . Brilliant
reviews.title: A Real Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have eaten here twice now & on both occassions it has been outstanding.
reviews.title: food & room was fab!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room, was very modern but slick, so this gave me a sense of money well spent.
reviews.title: brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Staff were great esspecially the guy on reception who made you feel welcome.
reviews.title: Great for a shopping trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food was freshly cooked and beautifully presented and decent portions, lovely! We had pudding and there were plenty of sumptuous desserts to choose from really gorgeous Jaffa cake pudding! We indulged in the peanut chocolate popcorn which was cooked especially for us! Everything was perfect! Service was excellent staff were nice and friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble
reviews.title: Friday ladies lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative was we ordered bread to start and that was £2 for 3 pieces I think it should be complimentary.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Well worth going to this beautiful brand new hotel!
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights (8/9th Sept) to celebrate our 45th anniversary. What a special stay we had with the staff so attentive, spectacular design and decor, luxurious surroundings and superb food in the Restaurant Aalto. We especially appreciated the upgrade from an Executive Room to a Suite and the nice touches like the complementary bottle of wine in the fridge and chocolates waiting for us in the room. It didn't stop there however. After each meal in the restaurant we received either compementary truffles or glasses of champagne. This was truly a memorable experience and one which we hope to repeat in the not too distant future. Many thanks to the management and all the staff for making us feel so welcome.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with exceptional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last Saturday night (8th) for one night through 'secret escapes'.
reviews.title: Hi Tech Excellent Hotel
Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband as my daughter lives in Birmingham. The Hotel is stunning, you can tell a lot of thought has gone into this place! I wasn't sure about the fancy checking kiosks at first (being older I'm not au fair with technology) but they were actually very straight forward, a bit like airport checking.

reviews.title: Destined to be the best in town
reviews.text: The rooms are very comfortable-great beds, with a choice of hard/soft pillows which my husband liked. The newspaper on the loo made us chuckle, which turned out to be the menu/hotel brochure..we took that with us! The view wasn't great, but we weren't really worried as we were going out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a drink in the bar, which was very pleasant my husband was spoilt for choice with the selection of beers and Ales, and the furnishings are lovely. We didn't have dinner, but really wish we had as the menu looks fabulous..but we made up for it at breakfast,I liked that breakfast ran until 11am and was definitely worth the extra £12 we paid when we booked.
reviews.title: Restaurant etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: We had a trip out to Warwick the next day, 30mins on a train which was a spur of the moment thing, the train station is just next to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great to the last hurdle service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest thing for me though was the staff, they just can't do enough for you, (checking train times for us and delivering them to our table at breakfast) everywhere in the hotel we were greeted with a smile and a hello, they clearly love theyre jobs! I definitely would recommend staying here..and for such a classy hotel, it's not expensive!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel - some work still needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights whilst visiting Birmingham to see the Lion King. A very good modern hotel with everything you need. Pleasant staff on reception, professional rather than personal. Great bar staff serving wonderful cocktails. Lovely entertainment on Friday and Saturday evening. Didn't eat in the restaurant as wanted to try Thai restaurant in the city centre, but had the burger from bar menu on 1st evening which was very tasty. Had a great relaxing weekend and can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Lovely stay, great cocktails!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was our second stay at the hotel.as impressed as first time around.lovely bar and balcony area where we sat in the sunshine.not the best of views but still nice to enjoy a cocktail and people watch.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: rooms spotless,airy and bright

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am going to give a good review as we enjoyed this modern hotel and the restaurant meal, but there were one or two glitches.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay in a modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night on a Groupn deal which included £20 per person off the evening meal. It is easy to find (we went by train) as it is close to Moor Street station and you can't miss its large modern outline. Reception was friendly and efficient (we thought) though they appeared not to inform the restaurant of our dinner reservation. The room was spacious with a comfortable bed and good size bathroom. The view was nothing special, but not too worried about that. However the air con did not seem to work as I could not get the room temp below 24C and the TV was a complete mystery. It did not appear to respond to the remote control and if we got a programme it was more luck than judgement. And why then was it BBC East and not West Midlands?
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We arrived at the Aalto restaurant at the time reserved, but they had no record of us. Unfortunately we also arrived at the same time as two large corporate groups. We waited nearly 45 minutes for bread to arrive and it was obvious that the kitchen was struggling to meet the orders from the groups. Having said that, when the food did come (and it was quick enough once they got going on our order) it was very good. My wife had sea bass and I had cock-a -leekie pie as main courses. The wine is pricey, I saw nothing under £22 and we settled for a French viognier/sauvignon which was tasty if expensive at £29.You order the wine from an IPad which is perhaps a step too far when it comes to perusing a wine list.
reviews.title: Fantastic for business!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was nearly faultless with a good choice from the buffet, albeit it could have been a bit hotter. The waitress was very nice and helpful though.
reviews.title: A real treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Despite these niggles we liked the hotel and the modern clean feel to it. The staff go out of their way to be friendly and I hope they can address some of the little things I have mentioned. It makes an excellent location for a city break (close to the big shops) or a business stopover.
reviews.title: Outstanding facilities and service...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: I have experienced staying at Hotel La Tour, 2 meals at Alto and the high tea. All of which have been amazing! Checking in was simple and the staff were very friendly and helpful, our hotel room was high tech, extremely clean and to a really high standard, the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in!
reviews.title: Book your stay and meal now!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alto is modern and a breath of fresh air. It's nice to eat wonderful food but not to be surrounded by pretentious people. Love the wine list on the ipad too! (the bar man makes a mean mojito too)
reviews.title: Great last minute romantic evening away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I did find it very hard to choose what to eat though as everything looks so delicious and you never had to wait too long for your food. The waiters are friendly and always there when you need them, I enjoyed watching the chefs cooking in the kitchen. If you are having a girly day out shopping I would definatly regiment their High tea and maybe even a cheeky glass of their champagne!
reviews.title: A pleasure to be away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right I'm going to stop going on now. All in all I would rate all of my experiences at Hotel La Tour as excellent and I would recommend it to you all! Enjoy :-)
reviews.title: Excellent city centre hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: We booked a package deal for a 2-course evening meal, breakfast, and overnight stay which served us perfectly for a last minute overnight stay. The staff were all really friendly and helpful, the room was a good size with a lovely bathroom. Unfortunately there was no radio/music facility to plug into but that was a minor detail. The restaurant and bar was really modern and had a great selection of cocktails & wine, and the food was fabulous! We had a wonderful evening and it was close enough to the train station to walk but there was absolutely no noise at all! I would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Wonderfull relaxing modern hotel with security features to make you feel safe in a major city location. Staff were fabulous.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel with friends for 1 night. Having stayed in Birmingham many times for both business and pleasure it was with interest that I saw a new hotel had opened. It is a very eyecatching design, with sharp angles, glass and granite a plenty. Inside the foyer, although still very modern, there is a calm and relaxed atmosphere. Modern comfy chairs, oversized lampshades and a spiral staircase leading to the 1st floor bar all catch your eye. Check-in was quick and efficient and we were allowed access to our room a couple of hours early as it was ready. We enjoyed drinks in the sunshine on the small terrace and all is good! Prices weren't too bad either for a stylish hotel, with a pint of ice cold Becks at £3.90. The rooms were very swish. We had an executive room and the 42" TV, rain-forest shower and mattress topper all made for a VERY comfortable experience. Breakfast was 7-11, so no crack of dawn starts after a night on the tiles. This was very nice, with a great choice of hot or cold food. The service was impeccable, both in the restaurant and throughout the hotel, so well done. The only downside with the hotel is that there is no on-site parking. There are carparks nearby, both NCP and open air public ones, so do some research re distance and prices before setting off. EXCELLENT hotel, will come back.
reviews.title: The overall package could make this a modern classic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 1 night as a treat for my partner's birthday. The staff were extremely accommodating and very friendly. The level of service was excellent. The rooms are very clean with sufficient space for two. The service we received in the Alto Restaurant was exceptional and would recommend staying. Special mention to Robert on reception, Kelly serving in Alto and Adrian who made our stay even more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a fabulous time, would stay again
reviews.title: Excellent new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a night with secret escapes and were extremely happy with the place. It was perfectly clean and is a lovely looking hotel. The rooms are relatively spacious, especially the showers. However, there isn't much cupboard space so beware if staying for more than a night. I particularly enjoyed the room technology but for those technophobes, this hotel is possibly not for you.
reviews.title: City Centre Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was amazing! I don't generally eat cooked breakfast and so don't often find much alternative but the continental was fantastic with great pastries. The staff were friendly and we chose to have bar snacks instead of an evening meal which were extremely nice. Free wi-fi as well was a great extra and the 24/7 gym. Would definitely recommend staying here, especially as it is rather quiet at the moment. It is right next to the Bull ring as well for shopping purposes.
reviews.title: Definately will return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a wonderful night away, on a last minute secret escapes offer. Ticked all of our boxes! Super shower, bed, mod cons, quiet, clean,comfy, great location, lovely meal and breakfast. Couldn't really fault anything apart from found air conditioning didn't work very well, got a bit hot and you can't open the windows. Great deal if you park at Selfridges car park, only £5.00 if the hotel stamp your ticket. View of the bullring from the hotel, so near to the shops but so quiet. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: We will be back! Great city hotel and restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst thing about this review is that we only stayed for one night....damn it. We took the advice of other trip advisors and parked at selfridges...i would suggest walking through the bull ring rather than the road direct as less inviting for the mrs. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a superior room from executive, an extremely nice touch as it was my girlfriends birthday. The place was spotless, new, clean innovative.
reviews.title: Could nto be improved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Andrew at the bar was a delight and helped provie an off the cuff cocktail for after dinner. Service from the front staff for a taxi was great.
reviews.title: Fantastic Wedding Night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The best thing is that this was an inclusive package as it was midweek. breakfast for two included, normally at £33 for two, £40 of credit at the bar!!!! and an upgrade all for £159. Fantastic. If you are staying ni Birmingham go....I'll add a review for our meal at Purnell's soon.
reviews.title: Centrally located with very comfy bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is almost exactly a year late but I just wanted to say what an amazing few days we had staying at Hotel La Tour. Last year I stayed at this hotel from the 5-8th October, the night before my wedding, the night of the wedding and two nights after. My stay involved a couple of room changes as I stayed in a different room to the suite we spent our wedding night in but the staff moved my bags and made the transition very smooth. Everybody was friendly and professional, although we tried to stay low key all of the staff seemed to know we were honeymooners and we were congratulated and given little perks wherever we went. The restaurant manager gave us champagne instead of prosecco, our dessert was sent up to our room along with other perks such as free alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages.
reviews.title: excellent hotel, dodgy area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights, booked on a deal with Secret Escapes, which made it fantastic value.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel in a Great Location
Nice bed
reviews.text: The hotel is very new and the decor is contemporary and stylish. Our room was comfortable and the bed was huge. The only glitch was the television kept breaking down but the staff were quick to resolve it when it happened. Previous posters have mentioned that the views from the rooms weren't that great, but the hotel is in the middle of the city so we weren't expecting much. The rooms are very quiet despite the city centre location. The staff were one of the highlights of the hotel as everyone we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. The service was outstanding throughout our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was well laid out with a variety of options. Free wi-fi was appreciated and it was able to handle me streaming the French Open tennis final onto my ipad when our television gave up the ghost. We parked in Selfridges car park and due to a deal with the hotel it only cost us £5 for 48 hours. The hotel is very well located, within minutes walk of the Bullring.
reviews.title: PLEASE READ! Nice looking completely let down by it's staff. Definitely wouldn't visit again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we are hoping to return soon.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night on 13/6/12. Check in was smooth and friendly. The room was modern with a huge bed, flat screen tv, tea/coffee making facilities and chair. The bathroom had a huge walk in shower.
reviews.title: Modern design, brand new... but still some lessons to learn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here recently on a Secret Escapes deal,we travelled in by train,the Hotel has been open approx 6wks,from the moment you walk through the door the staff are there to help you and give you a tour round and tell you how it operates,they are all so proud of it,but all so very happy to be there,its the happiest hotel I think we have ever been too,
reviews.title: An amazing Hotel with wonderful happy staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 4th floor,the corriders were a delight to walk through with beautiful and unusual
reviews.title: Dining at Aalto restaurant.

reviews.text: swirly pattened carpets and amazing full lengh windows at either end which didnt look as if there was any glass in them,also quite nice at night looking at all the lights and buildings even though there is a lot of work going on outside, roads being changed you could not hear anything in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Great new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Love this hotel, it's comfortable, elegant, clean, great food and fab staff...totally recommend this to anyone wanting a lovely treat, really affordable as well.thank you for making our stay so great! When you come to birmingham stay here!
reviews.title: Second time here and just fantastic!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing stay, wonderful hotel, great food and welcoming charming staff. This will be my preferred hotel in Birmingham from now onwards.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here midweek for two nights in a superior room with breakfast. Furnishing and decor are modern, plush and extremely clean. Spacious and light for a city centre location, but they also managed to make the spaces feel intimate as well. Our room was large with a desk area, HUGE bathroom with double shower and bath (with TV), bed, large TV and seating area. Impeccably clean and comfortable with little extras like chocolates, cold water and a coffee machine.
reviews.title: Excellent restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a small carpark which costs £10 per night, but has arrangements with two other carparks for reduced parking. We decided to park in the Selfridges carpark (as per the hotel instructions), but got confused because once you get into the carpark all the signage and tickets refer to it as the Bullring carpark. But it cost us £5 for the whole stay as we did not move the car.
reviews.title: Modern and classy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had drinks at the bar the first night, which were reasonably priced compared to local pubs and restaurants and the bar staff were very welcoming and friendly, whilst making us feel like guests.
reviews.title: All sparkling and new!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel La Tour for two nights while we were in town for a concert. Our room was lovely, modern and sophisticated. Our booking was through Secret Escapes,with a good price and an offer of a bottle of wine in the restaurant if we booked in for dinner.Everyone that we came in contact with was lovely, starting with Justin in Reception, to the staff in the restaurant, bar, and housekeeping. We ate in Aalto Restaurant one night and had drinks each night in Alvar Bar. The food was excellent, well presented, prompt, and the servers were present but not intrusive. Although we never had many dealings with Jo in the Restaurant, I would like to mention her. I am a manager in customer service and I watched the dynamic that Jo had with her staff (I am assuming she is a manager there). She was present, on top of everything and delegated to the staff with kind words and mannerisms. I just thought that she should be mentioned for her exemplary service as we saw her in the restaurant in the evenings and then met her again for the breakfast.
reviews.title: Classy and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this hotel for its staff, service, location and price.
reviews.title: Stay at La Tour Birmingham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Considering this was my first Visit to Birmingham we picked a great ultra modern hotel! Check in was very quick using the self service style check in machine. The room was very bright and had a huge window letting lots of natural light in. Brilliant location the hotel was within walking distance from the train station, main shopping center and restaurants. The breakfast was great but could of been a bit better organised by the staff.
reviews.title: Great room, hugely disorganised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed for one night after a wedding. The location is excellent, the rooms are lovely but the service lacks a little. To park the car, you have to go into the hotel and ask them to come and open the gates for you which is very inefficient. The breakfast was a shambles, we arrived at 10am, they had no tables. We had to sit and wait for 20 minutes and nobody was apologetic about this. When we did get a table, there were plenty free, they were just not being cleared away fast enough. After sitting at the table for 10 minutes, we were asked whether we would like tea or coffee, unfortunately we never got it. On the plus side, the breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Modern, Comfortable, Clean & Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night on business trip - couldn't really fault it. Great price, great location, very clean and the staff were welcoming, professional and friendly. Breakfast was good too. If we ever travel to Birmingham again, will definitely book at Hotel La Tour!
reviews.title: Flawless hotel for the price

description: Hotel La Tour is a four star standard hotel with a five star attitude to customer service. Located in Birmingham city centre, it has 174 bedrooms and suites,the buzzing Alvar Bar and its brasserie-style Aalto Restaurant serves modern classics inspired by Head Chef Dan Pearce and a dedicated conference and events floor accommodates up to 140 delegates in a choice of sophisticated meeting spaces.
